channel.title: Suitability for children?
channel.description: Does anyone have any experience of using the Axoloti Core for teaching with children or with children using it on their own? I have some friends who have children who are into synthesizers and wondering at what age people would recommend this as it could make a rather cool gift (with an enclosure)?

item.title: Suitability for children?
item.dc:creator: @ABMorley Andrew Morley
item.description:
@ABMorley wrote:

Completely agree - I gave one to one of my children aged 12 and it's been a massive success, both MIDI mangling and audio manipulation. Big success and thoroughly recommended.

Read full topic

item.title: Suitability for children?
item.dc:creator: @kjw
item.description:
@kjw wrote:

Thanks for your thoughts. The built-in speaker is an interesting feature. It's one the professionals are often puzzled over with some of the small stuff from Korg but I can see how this makes it more accessible/fun for children.

I've just ordered a few so it'll be interesting to see how they are received. I'll see if one of my colleagues who runs a Code Club can integrate it into a session. That's 9-11yr olds.

Read full topic

item.title: Suitability for children?
item.dc:creator: @Quincas Quincas Moreira
item.description:
@Quincas wrote:

Depends a lot on the kid and their interests, but I'd say 12 and up. Unless you give it with an enclosure with fun controls and a fixed patch already loaded, battery power and built in speaker, in which case it can be a fun musical toy for any age.

Read full topic
